intro: Sida sivarajanii, commonly known as Sivarajan’s sida, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and hairy leaves. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. Sida sivarajanii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
